intro: Hieracium cardiophyllum, commonly known as the heart-leaved hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist and well-drained conditions. Its leaves are heart-shaped, which gives it its common name, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Hieracium cardiophyllum is often found in temperate regions and is sometimes considered a weed in agricultural areas.
